section.title: Inversion of Control and Dependency Injection
section.para:
In early 2004, Martin Fowler asked the readers of his site: when talking about Inversion of Control:
the question is, what aspect of control are [they] inverting? . After talking about the term Inversion of Control, Fowler suggested renaming the principle (or at least giving it a more self-explanatory name), and started to use the term Dependency Injection. His article then continued to explain the ideas underpinning the Inversion of Control (IoC) and Dependency Injection (DI) principle.
If you need a decent insight into IoC and DI, please do refer to said article : http://martinfowler.com/articles/injection.html.
